title: Chaos and Panic Grip Tehran as Airstrikes Shake City
summary: Iranians were beginning their workweek as U.S. and Israeli strikes sent people fleeing parts of the capital and parents racing to collect children from schools.

title: What to Know About the U.S. Attacks on Iran
summary: The United States, joined by Israel, launched an attack on major cities in Iran, as President Trump called on Iranians to overthrow the government.

title: OpenAI Reaches A.I. Agreement With Defense Dept. After Anthropic Clash
summary: The deal came hours after President Trump had ordered federal agencies to stop using artificial intelligence technology made by Anthropic, an OpenAI rival.

title: Trump Orders U.S. Agencies to Stop Using Anthropic AI Tech After Pentagon Standoff
summary: The company had clashed with the military over how officials wanted to use its cutting-edge A.I. model. The order could vastly complicate intelligence analysis and defense work.

title: Taiwan Arms Sale Approved by Congress Is Delayed as Trump Plans Visit to Beijing
summary: The package worth billions of dollars and endorsed by lawmakers is stalled at the State Department as the U.S. and China plan an April summit.

title: Pentagon Watchdog Stalls Proposal to Review Targeting in Trump’s Boat Strikes
summary: A new inspector general delayed a decision on whether to approve the project and is said to have raised its potential political ramifications, in a test of the watchdog system in President Trump’s second term.

title: The Bloody Rise and Fall of Mexico’s Top Crime Boss
summary: El Mencho’s brutality and business acumen put him atop the cartel world, until he made a fatal mistake.

title: How The Times Covers Cartels and Other Criminal Enterprises
summary: Cultivating sources. Verifying claims. Staying safe. After the death of El Mencho, four journalists share their approach to this difficult, dangerous work.

title: Abrupt Change for Warner Bros. Prompts Many Grim Faces
summary: Employees at the company had started to warm to the idea of Netflix as its corporate owner. Now they face the prospect of major cuts under Paramount.

title: Netflix Lost Warner. Maybe That’s a Good Thing.
summary: It is entirely possible, analysts say, that Netflix will be better off by bailing from its $83 billion deal with Warner Bros. Discovery.

title: Why Have You Started This War, Mr. President?
summary: Donald Trump promised voters that he would end wars, not start them.

title: How Israel Lost Americans
summary: Netanyahu and his government deserve the growing bipartisan opprobrium they’re receiving.

title: L.A.U.S.D. Chief Alberto Carvalho Is Placed on Leave Following F.B.I. Raid
summary: Alberto Carvalho, superintendent of the Los Angeles Unified School District, was placed on paid leave after F.B.I. agents raided his home and district office this week.

title: Carney Visiting India, Australia and Japan to Build Canada’s ‘Middle Power’ Bonds
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney visits India, Australia and Japan seeking deals to strengthen his country’s links to Indo-Pacific powers and break Canada’s dependence on the United States.

title: Neil Sedaka, Singing Craftsman of Memorable Pop Songs, Dies at 86
summary: He sang and co-wrote some of the definitive teenage anthems of the 1950s and early ’60s, including “Breaking Up Is Hard to Do,” and then reinvented his career in the ’70s.
